{"step_by_step_thinking": "The fetus in the question has several features suggestive of a specific syndrome, namely intrauterine growth restriction, microcephaly, convex-rounded feet, clenched fists with overlapping fingers, and a ventricular septal defect. These are all features of Trisomy 18, also known as Edwards syndrome. Other common features of this syndrome include a prominent occiput, rocker-bottom feet, and clenched hands with overlapping fingers. Therefore, the most likely additional finding in this fetus would be a prominent occiput.", "answer_choice": "D. Prominent occiput"}
